project.teaser: A carbon-neutral European Union by 2050 is an ambitious target that presents technical and societal challenges. While technical research is advancing rapidly to reach a net-zero target, the overall skillsets of the working force are lagging behind in understanding, employing...
project.objective: A carbon-neutral European Union by 2050 is an ambitious target that presents technical and societal challenges. While technical research is advancing rapidly to reach a net-zero target, the overall skillsets of the working force are lagging behind in understanding, employing and mastering sustainable technologies for the business models. Therefore, the RES4City project envisions a codesigned educational framework for upskilling the workforce to integrate, influence and combine the current sustainability best practices for renewable energies and fuel technologies. The main pathways to reach this objective are the definition of microprogrammes, the development of serious games for learning and training, the establishment of the industry-academy programme and the analysis of industry-based case studies for the fast track towards sustainability and circular economy. In addition, the program will focus on developing and testing the program in coordination with different stakeholders such as public governance, industry, NGOs, and citizens. Within the program, a separate task on inclusivity and gender balance will promote and ensure the participation of a representative cohort of students. The thematic area selected for the project is the cities. The link between these sectors is intrinsically defined, and they have extensive unexploited opportunities for renewable energy deployment and fossil fuel substitution to improve their sustainability and the massive potential of circularity implementation.
project.title: Renewable Energies System for Cities
project.keywords: sustainable business models, smart city, decarbonisation, positive energy district, sustainability, circular economy, codesign, open innovation, educational framework

article.title: Upskilling the workforce to boost renewable energy technologies

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - RES4CITY (Renewable Energies System for Cities)
result.description: periodic
result.teaser: The RES4CITY.eu project addresses the dual challenges of achieving a carbon-neutral European Union by 2050 and upskilling the workforce to master sustainable technologies. While technical research progresses rapidly towards net-zero, the workforce's understanding and...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: RES4CITY integrated website
result.description: The deliverable is linked to T63 and it is the website deployed as a wordpress platform at M4 and regularly updated with contents news and project materials The the website is seamless integrated with the UPx MOOC platform and with self assessment IA tool It is also implemented with advanced analytics capabilities to collect data on the user interaction The website details the designed microprogrammes and enlists the available microcredential and exemplifying the creation of customised learning paths It is deployed on a local server Monthly updates up to M36

result.title: Sustainable Cities and Society

details.authors: Ivan Cuesta-Fernández, Carlos Vargas-Salgado, David Alfonso-Solar, Tomás Gómez-Navarro

result.title: Report on CED activities
result.description: The deliverable is linked to T6.5 and it is a report periodically summarise the CED activities carried out during the project and impact generated. It track the KPIs to monitor the impact of the activities. The report is updated at M36 to develop the final assessment at the end of the project. It collects data from all the partners and a summary of the activities is published on the RES4CITY website.

result.title: Education needs and upskilling opportunities in the renewable energy sector
result.description: Dedicated task for the codesign of user centred educational program the report is linked with the activities in WP2 and T34 It identifies the technological economic and social barriers and challenges that limit the deployment of RES and sustainable fuel technologies in urban contexts collecting input and feedback from the industrial stakeholders and companies It will be updated at M24

result.title: Circularity and Sustainability Roadmap for the urban context (v1.1)
result.description: The deliverable is linked to T2.1 and it is a critical description of the current context, challenges, barriers and future perspectives of sustainable RES and fuel technologies in urban contexts. The deliverable is led by UNIPARTHENOPE but other partners contributes such as UNIGE, UCOI, UPV, UNISS, DTU, 3OC, WTC, TIPP, FINN, UNITAR. It will provide a roadmap for the decarbonisation of cities and it will consist of a publishable report with sections on buildings, transport and energy system integration. It will be updated at M18 after an internal review and feedback for improvement. Update at M18.

result.title: RES4CITY Professional microprogrammes
result.description: The deliverable is linked to T4.4 and it includes the all the microcredential modules of the professional programme uploaded on the MOOC platform with related documentation. All the partners have uploaded the content of their courses on the platform and the WP leader verifies the contents. This deliverable includes all the microcredentials related to the professional programmes.

result.title: Implementation of energy reduction strategies and follow up in a typical house in la Huerta of València

details.authors: R. Royo, M. Cañada-Soriano, C. Montagud-Montalvá, E. Peñalvo
details.journalTitle: 18th Conference on Sustainable Development of Energy, Water and Environment Systems (SDEWES)

result.title: Serious games deployment
result.description: The deliverable is lined to T4.2 and it includes the serious game deployment on a dedicated web server or cloud space with related guidelines. The deliverable is in the form of deployed web based software on a server. The user interface and backend are tested against several user testing cases. Bug testing is addressed with a possible update at M22.

result.title: Outline of RES4CITY learning and upskilling programmes
result.description: The deliverable is linked to T2.4. This deliverable defines the micro programmes, procedures, contents and the structure of the microprogrammes. It includes the subject areas, educational objectives, learning outcomes, admissions and attestation procedures, and available virtual facilities - i.e., MOOC platform and self-assessment tools (T4.1) and serious games (T2.5). The report is complementary to the description of the microcredentials and it will allow the grouping of microcredentials in programmes. Possible update at M20

result.title: Diagnosis of the building stock using Energy Performance Certificates for urban energy planning in Mediterranean compact cities. Case of study: The city of València in Spain

details.authors: Á. Manso-Burgos , D. Ribó-Pérez, J.Van As , C. Montagud-Montalvá , R. Royo-Pastor

result.title: Energies

details.authors: Mattia De Rosa,Vincenzo Bianco,Henrik Bartha,Patricia Pereira da Silva,Carlos Vargas Salgado and Fabiano Pallonetto

result.title: Recovery of waste heat from data centres for decarbonisation of university campuses in a Mediterranean climate

details.authors: C. Montagud-Montalvá a, E. Navarro-Peris a, T. Gómez-Navarro a, X. Masip-Sanchis b, C. Prades-Gil b

result.title: Open Innovation Book and Policy Brief
result.description: The deliverable is linked to T6.2 and it is a report on the limitations, challenges and benefit on the decarbonisation of the EU. The Open Book Innovation Book (KER3) is based on the lighthouse case studies and it is complementary to the Policy Brief (KER9) that examines and aligns with the different sectoral policies and EU directives such as the Offshore Renewable Energy Strategy. It envisions policy scenarios and provide a bottom up perspective for the mass deployment of renewable energy in urban context. Update at M34.

result.title: Report on Replication and Exploitation activities
result.description: The deliverable is linked to T6.5 and the report is focused on the RES4CITY replication and exploitation activities and strategy for post-project replication. It contains a business plan to keep the platform active after the project and to exploit potential business opportunities for further deployment and specialisation of the platform towards professional training services for upskilling actual workforce in companies. The report also contains other options for the replication and expansion of the educational ecosystem developed. Update at M36.

result.title: A multidisciplinary microcredential basket for the sustainable transition in cities
result.description: The deliverable summarise the results of T23 Identification of knowledge gaps and retraining opportunities designing a specification document for the microcredentials basket As reported by KPI 511 and 1 the document describes at least 55 microcredentials for the training and reskilling opportunities social and environmental aspects in the RES and FT and on Circular Economy Action PlanCritical Raw Material recyclingbydesignThe document identify the responsible partner and educator the learning objectives the microcredential program plan and the assessmentThe document will be used for WP4 to assign and catalog the microcredentials deployed in the platform Possible updates at M20

result.title: Project dissemination and communication materials
result.description: The deliverable is linked to T6.4 and it is a report periodically summarises the activities of dissemination and communication illustrated in the dissemination and communication plan. The activities are linked to different stakeholders with a clear distinction between the communication and dissemination activities. The report details also the progress on reaching the KPIs declared at the proposal stage Part B in section 2.2.2. Updates at M30.

result.title: Energy Conversion and Management

details.authors: C. Montagud-Montalvá, E. Navarro-Peris, T. Gómez-Navarro, X. Masip-Sanchis, C. Prades-Gil

result.title: Design of an automatic optimization tool for the installation of solar photovoltaic panels on urban building rooftops

details.authors: Paula Bastida Molina, Miguel Ángel Hernández Flores Tomás Gómez Navarro, Carla Montagud Montalvá, Carlos Vargas Salgado
details.journalTitle: 18th Conference on Sustainable Development of Energy, Water and Environment Systems (SDEWES)

result.title: RES4CITY multidisciplinary and multi sector lighthouses
result.description: The deliverable is linked to T22 and it is a description of the RE4CITY lighthouse case studies The lighthouse are selected case studies linked to a specific energy related urban challenge and they are identified in T21 Each of the case studies will cover a different perspective of innovation and technology such as environmental sustainability social equality acceptance and diffusion The report lay the basis for Task 33 Enhancing RES and FT sustainable deployment and to publish an open innovation book and policy brief D62 Update at M24

result.title: Self-assessment tool
result.description: The deliverable is linked to T4.1 and it deploy the self-assessment tool on the website integrated with the MOOC platform with related guidelines, the deliverable is in the form of deployed web based software on a server. The user interface and backend are tested against several user testing cases. Bug testing is addressed with a possible update at M18.

result.title: Networking activities to promote sustainability and circularity
result.description: The deliverable is linked to T33 The report describes all the networking events to engage with stakeholders and promote the concept developed during the project It provides the context and highlights the commonalities and the motivations to participate to the events in line with the main objectives of the proposal It will be updated at M24 and M36

result.title: District energy modelling for decarbonisation strategies development—The case of a University campus

details.authors: Pierce S, Pallonetto F, De Donatis L, De Rosa M.

result.title: A set of serious games for massive societal impact: design and features
result.description: The deliverable is linked to T2.5 and it is a description of RES4CITY serious games objectives, structures and features. Based on the outcome of T2.1 and T2.2, an interactive simulated environment, stimulating the decision-making process, is designed based on a set of three serious games (i.e., warm up game, business simulation game and role play game). As output of T2.5, the deliverable embeds design of the simulation storyboard in all its storylines, the user journey, wireframe and it collects the technical requirements of the games.

result.title: Stakeholders identification and mapping
result.description: The deliverable is linked to T32 and it describes a map of stakeholders and their needs and potential integration in RES4City project The report documents the outcome of monthly meetings between the office and the partners involved and monitor of all actions involving the stakeholders It documents on the strategy as planned in T31 engagement actions and knowledge transfer at local and european level The report will also contains summary of surveys results workshops and consultationsUpdates at M20 and M36

result.title: RES4CITY: Multidisciplinary and Multi-sector Lighthouses

details.authors: Marcos Tenente, Patrícia Pereira da Silva , Adélio Gaspar, Álvaro Gomes, Carla Henriques, Bruno Cardoso, Ana Rita Amaral, Francisco Simões

result.title: Circularity and Sustainability Roadmap for the urban context
result.description: The deliverable is linked to T21 and it is a critical description of the current context challenges barriers and future perspectives of sustainable RES and fuel technologies in urban contexts The deliverable is led by UNIGE but other partners contributes such as UCOI UPV UNISS DTU 3OC WTC TIPP FINN UNITAR It will provide a roadmap for the decarbonisation of cities and it will consist of a publishable report with sections on buildings transport and energy system integration It will be updated at M18 after an internal review and feedback for improvement Update at M18

result.title: Final report on the event and the results in terms of engagement and industry involvement
result.description: The deliverable is linked to T3.4 and it includes a final report on the industry-academia program and the results in terms of impact and industry engagement. The report includes a detailed description on all the activities related to open innovation competition on the circular economy namely Accellerathon. It describes the participant contributions and the solutions for the implementation of the ideas proposed during the program. It will be updated at M32.

result.title: RES4CITY Educational microprogrammes
result.description: The deliverable is linked to T4.3 and it includes the all the microcredential modules of the educational programme uploaded on the MOOC platform with related documentation. All the partners have uploaded the content of their courses on the platform and the WP leader verifies the contents. This deliverable includes all the microcredentials related to the educational programmes.

category.title: nongovernmental organizations
category.displayCode: /social sciences/political sciences/political policies/civil society/civil society organisations/nongovernmental organizations

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
